intro: Cyperus melanocephalus, commonly known as black-headed flatsedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the sedge family (Cyperaceae) and is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded soils, often found in marshy areas or along the edges of water bodies. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are followed by triangular, dark brown to black seed pods, which give it its common name. Cyperus melanocephalus is often used in ornamental gardening due to its ability to thrive in moist conditions and its distinctive appearance.
